artist: Designer: Probably James H. Bowen; Manufacturer: J. & E. Stevens Company, Cromwell, Connecticut, 1843–1950s
description: clown in white costume twirls female figure dressed in red and blue; harlequin with red scarf on his head and black mask stands with stick held across chest
inscription:
Inscription and Sticker

on bottom, inscribed: [PAT APD FOR.]
markings: on bottom, on sticker: [576 1-1-2 / Clown, Harlequin and Columbine / 15,000 81 AD NiN / IV / M119]
title: "Clown, Harlequin and Columbine" mechanical bank
